programme.title: Fort Osage
programme.desc: A scout (Rod Cameron) leads a wagon train through territory made hostile by a violated treaty.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill stops a trail boss from harassing a saloon girl; the humiliated trail boss then uses an eager young man to join his group and get revenge on Bill.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill tries to help a young woman being pursued by two men; the men tell Bill that she's a thief, and they are bringing her back to the gunfighter she is fleeing from; unfortunately, her experience with the man has made her bitter towards all men.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill stops at an inn, where he meets an old lawman friend holding two convicted killers; the lawman is wounded, and Bill must take responsibility of the prisoners.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: The local bank is robbed while Bill is participating in a shooting contest; a photographer friend of Bill's is killed, but he happened to catch a picture of the robbers just before they shot him.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Working with a posse, Bill captures a bank robber and the stolen money; the rest of the posse want to split the loot, but Bill refuses so the posse decide to kill him; luckily, a band of Comancheros interrupts their plans.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill is ambushed and his horse is stolen; he's forced to travel by stagecoach, one he shares with wanted outlaw Pony Sloan; after stopping at a way station, a man there tells Bill the other side to Sloan's story.

programme.title: The Outrage
programme.desc: A Mexican bandit (Paul Newman), a victim (Claire Bloom), an Indian and a prospector have different versions of a rape/murder.

programme.title: Red River Range
programme.desc: The Three Mesquiteers (John Wayne, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune) catch cattle rustlers who use refrigerated trucks.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy goes to Mexico to investigate mass murders of Chinese workers.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A Gypsy seeks to clear his father of charges of robbery.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Saboteurs try to prevent Arizona's first telegraph line.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Gold thieves frame a young friend of Hoppy's for murder.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy's lawyer nephew represents a bank robber.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A missing man's son speaks of ghosts and strange occurrences.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy investigates a counterfeiting operation; Red is shot dead.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A young Mexican farmer disappears, suspected of a banker's murder.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt Clark and Frankie Adams pursue a female outlaw named Belle Starr after her gang steals a herd of horses from the U.S. cavalry.

programme.title: The Cheyenne Social Club
programme.desc: Two cowboys (James Stewart, Henry Fonda) ride from Texas to Wyoming to claim an inheritance which turns out to be a brothel.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Frankie befriends an outlaw after his gang robs the train.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: While investigating a train robbery, Matt Clark learns about Johnny Ringo; Frankie gets a job doing undercover work; Matt tracks Johnny down.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Former deputies plan on robbing a gold shipment after their brother is killed.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie head to Tombstone, Arizona to track down Doc Holliday who they suspect is involved with the Clanton gang; while there, they meet famed sheriff Wyatt Earp and become part of the gunfight at OK Corral.

programme.title: Guns of Diablo
programme.desc: A wagon master is confronted by a man he wounded years before in episodes from "The Travels of Jaimie McPheeters.".

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A former gunfighter becomes a doctor hoping to make up for his past.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A Chinese man and his son plan to settle in North Fork.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Romilly Vale ruins Yancy's plans for a quiet evening gambling at Madame Francine's.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: A madman steals ten cases of dynamite from the arsenal to bomb New Orleans.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A young bank robber gets a job on the Ponderosa to prevent the sheriff from finding the other members of his gang.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Hoss befriends a former Army scout (Henry Hull) who drinks to forget the massacre of his troop.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A Deputy U.S. Marshal arrives to escort a man to California to testify against a gang; guest Dan Duryea.

programme.title: Invitation to a Gunfighter
programme.desc: A town boss hires a gunslinger (Yul Brynner) to kill an outcast (George Segal), then hires the outcast to kill the gunslinger.
